div.span: This site has been in BETA for 2313 days

strong.span: ong with all Beaver County School Districts and the Career and Technical Center continue to work together as we receive guidance from our state and federal leaders. Today, Governor Wolf announced that all schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. Therefore, all Beaver County school facilities are closed and events cancelled through the end of the school year. While much uncertainty still exists, this announcement will allow families to plan for their needs in the coming months. All schools will continue to provide continuity of education and meals through the last regularly scheduled day of school. We understand that this is heartbreaking for the Class of 2020, but please be patient as we seek additional guidance from our state leaders regarding graduation and other special events. We appreciate your patience and support during this closure and we will continue to provide updates as we move forward together.

span.div: South Side Area School District remains committed to our students and families no matter the extenuating circumstances that may arise. During an extended school closure, such as the current COVID-19 pandemic, SSASD administrators and faculty plan to model resiliency for our students and remain connected to our district community by continuing to offer quality academic services through our Continuity of Education Plan.
CLICK HERE to view the full version of the Continuity of Education Plan Framework.

div.span: and the Career and Technical Center continue to work together as we receive guidance from our state and federal leaders. Governor Wolf has announced that the shelter-at-home order is extended through April 30 for the Commonwealth and PA schools will remain closed indefinitely.
CLICK READ MORE... in the bottom right corner of this window for the full statement from our School Superintendent.

td.a: A Message from the Director of Pupil Services

div.span:
South Side Area School District is committed to making a good faith effort to provide a continuity of education during the extended closure issued from the COVID-19 restrictions. Our efforts, starting on March 25, 2020, are consistent with the need to protect the health and safety of students with disabilities.
CLICK READ MORE... in the bottom right corner of this winodw for the full letter for our Director of Pupil Services.

div.style: color: #222222; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff; font-family: verdana, sans-serif
div.span: Welcome to Kindergarten 2020-2021! Registration is now open for kindergarten for the upcoming school year. Please call the elementary office to schedule an appointment at 724-573-9581 ext. 1401 or 1402. Once you have registered for a time for our upcoming kindergarten registration, please create a Sapphire Account with the necessary information.

td.a: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) letter from Beaver County Superintendents

span.span: The health, safety and well-being of our students and staff are our top priorities. With the recently elevated discussion regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the news, we want to take a moment to reinforce preventive safety measures and reference our process and communications.

p.style: margin-top: 2.25pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;line-height:100%

p.span: CLICK READ MORE... to learn about how school districts in Beaver County are dealing with COVID-19.

div.span: lWhile there are currently no cases of COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease) in Pennsylvania, Ohio, or West Virginia, South Side Area School District’s number one priority remains that of the safety, and well-being of our students and staff. As we continue to extensively monitor the spread of COVID-19 Virus (
) we would like to update you on the progressive preventative measures the district has already had in place.
CLICK READ MORE... for additional information about COVID-19 Virus.

td.a: 2020 PASmart Grant in the amount of $35,000

span.span: South Side Area School District has been awarded a 2020 PASmart Grant in the amount of $35,000. These funds have been granted to enhance Computer Science and STEM throughout the district. Staff will gain access to tools and training to bring opportunities to our students. These tools will work in parallel with the district’s developing computer science curriculum cycle. Most importantly, our students will increase their hands-on learning.

span.span: 9 weeks report card day January 31st, all SSASD report cards will be online only. Paper copies of report cards will no longer be sent home with students. To access report cards, log into your Sapphire account, click on the student name, then click on report cards. If you need assistance in setting up your Sapphire account, or if you would like to request a paper copy of a report card, please contact any building secretary for assistance. Also, if, for some reason, you need a paper copy of the report card, please ask the building secretary for one, and we will send it home with your child.
